headline: Ethereum ETFs on-chain holdings at all-time high
summary: Investments in Ethereum are accelerating in the past few weeks, leading the on-chain holdings of major funds to a new all-time high. The ongoing buying shows a clear accumulation trend where institutions are positioning for an ETH rally. The on-chain activity and holdings of Ethereum ETFs suggest the network and the token are nowhere near dead. ETH on-chain holdings for all major ETFs are close to an all-time high, after the last few weeks of accelerated accumulation. BlackRock was the most active buyer, driving the momentum of inflows to Ethereum ETFs. | Source: Dune Analytics Blackrock and Grayscale lead institutional demand for ETH ETF funds have bought over 3.77M ETH, or around 2.97% of the supply, currently above 120M ETH. Alternative data by CryptoQuant points to over 4M ETH acquired by all ETFs, with a market acceleration in June. The funds based on Ethereum have a much lower level of assets under management but stronger accumulation momentum. Inflows have surpassed BTC since the end of May. The ETFs are approaching $1B in accumulation per month. For now, BlackRock and Grayscale remain the biggest holders, with the most rapid new ETH inflows. Grayscale switched to accumulation in the past month, ending the era of divesting its ETH acquired for as low as $90. The accumulation happens at a time when ETH still trades sideways, at around $2,561.97, with a total market dominance of 9.03%. ETH stabilized at around 0.024 BTC, ending its long-term slide. The ETF accumulation is seen as just one of the positive signs for the Ethereum ecosystem, in addition to growing DeFi activity, stablecoin transfers, and general accumulation in both small and whale-sized wallets. ETFs are not the most significant destination for ETH, as many of the tokens are locked in protocols. Currently, Ethereum carries over $63.3B in total value locked, in addition to over 125B in stablecoins. Close to 30% of ETH is staked with validators, while leaving diminishing reserves on exchanges. In total, each week, 16,621 ETH is produced, smaller than one single day of ETF inflows. While Ethereum does not offer the same scarcity as BTC, ETFs still control a significant part of the supply. Ethereum ETFs show growing daily inflows Ethereum ETFs have seen much more lively inflows in the past few days, surpassing the accumulation of BTC. Spot Ethereum ETFs had an almost unbroken period of net daily inflows since the middle of May. This is the longest period of ETF accumulation since the bull rally in March 2024. However, this time, ETH trades at a lower range, after dipping as low as $1,200. Despite this, there is interest in the token, with the potential for a late but outsized rally to a higher price range. One of the possible effects of an ETH rally is the launch of a new altcoin market. Despite expectations for an altcoin rally in Q1, most old tokens failed to break out. ETH is considered the one factor to lift up other tokens and chains. ETF inflows also precede a new period of fund approvals. headline: Bitcoin Price Analysis: BTC Registers Sharp Drop As Middle East Crisis Worsens
summary: Bitcoin (BTC) made a promising start to the week, surging to an intraday high of $108,944 on Monday. However, the worsening situation in the Middle East prompted a sharp decline as markets turned bearish. As a result, the flagship cryptocurrency dropped to $106,806. BTC is down almost 1% during the ongoing session, trading around $105,897. Despite overwhelming selling pressure, the price has stayed above $105,000. Strategy Announces Latest Bitcoin Purchase Michael Saylor’s Strategy has announced that it purchased 10,100 BTC for approximately $1.05 billion at an average acquisition price of around $104,080 per coin. Strategy co-founder and executive chairman Michael Saylor announced the news in a post on X, stating, “Strategy has acquired 10,100 BTC for ~$1.05 billion at ~$104,080 per bitcoin and has achieved a BTC Yield of 19.1% YTD 2025. As of 6/15/2025, we hodl 592,100 acquired for ~$41.84 billion at ~$70,666 per bitcoin.” The latest Bitcoin purchase takes Strategy’s total holdings to a staggering 592,100 BTC , further cementing its place as the largest corporate holder of Bitcoin. Strategy has doubled down on its “buy and hold” strategy, using proceeds from equity and debt financing instead of its at-the-market programs. Notably, it did not sell any stock in the days leading up to its latest acquisition. Strategy’s management is convinced about BTC’s long-term value proposition. headline: Dow opens lower as Israel-Iran conflict weighs on investors
summary: Global stocks pared gains on Tuesday, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average opening more than 100 points lower in early trading as Israel and Iran continued attacks against each other. Alongside the Dow, the S&P 500 opened down 0.3%, while the Nasdaq Composite dropped 0.5%. These declines came as investors weighed the prospects of a quick truce versus a potential escalation of the Israel-Iran hostilities. U.S. President Donald Trump’s recent remarks and social media posts related to the conflict, as well as his early departure from the G7 summit, stoked fears that a swift ceasefire was unlikely. Trump said in a post on Truth Social : “Publicity seeking President Emmanuel Macron, of France, mistakenly said that I left the G7 Summit, in Canada, to go back to D.C. to work on a “cease fire” between Israel and Iran. headline: Bitcoin Exchange OKX Announces Launch in Two More European Countries! Here Are the Details
summary: Cryptocurrency exchange OKX has reached a major milestone in its European expansion strategy, with the company announcing that it has officially launched its fully regulated, licensed centralized exchanges in Germany and Poland. OKX Officially Launches Operations in Germany and Poland With this development, users in Germany and Poland will have access to over 270 cryptocurrencies, over 60 crypto-Euro trading pairs, low transaction fees, staking services, automated trading bots, and fast Euro deposit/withdrawal infrastructure. OKX identifies Germany and Poland as not only geographical but also strategic growth markets. The platforms offered in both countries have been developed in full compliance with local regulations and offer a fully localized user experience including website, mobile app and customer support. The company has appointed Moritz Putzhammer as general manager for Central Europe and Scandinavia, and Gabriel Manduca as general manager for Eastern Europe. Both men have extensive experience in both centralized finance (CeFi) and decentralized finance (DeFi) and will be actively involved in growing OKX’s European operations. headline: Judge Denies Alex Mashinsky Any Celsius Bankruptcy Payout – Creditors Win
summary: Chief United States Bankruptcy Judge Martin Glenn has officially denied former Celsius CEO Alex Mashinsky any claim to bankruptcy proceeds from the defunct crypto lender. The court order , entered on June 16, 2025, formally disallows all claims submitted by Mashinsky and his associated entities, including AM Ventures Holdings Inc., Koala1 LLC, and Koala3 LLC. This frees up reserved cash, liquid cryptocurrency, and MiningCo shares for distribution to legitimate creditors under the Chapter 11 reorganization plan. The stipulation agreement was reached on May 20, 2025, between Celsius litigation administrator Mohsin Meghji and Mashinsky. The court’s decision ensures that Celsius creditors, who have already received over $2.5 billion in distributions throughout 2024, will benefit from the release of funds held in reserve pending resolution of Mashinsky’s claims. Source: Stretto From Crypto Visionary to Convicted Fraudster Celsius Network, founded in 2017, positioned itself as a revolutionary alternative to traditional banking. It promised customers they could “unbank yourself” while earning double-digit yields on their cryptocurrency deposits. Mashinsky’s charismatic promotion of the platform attracted billions in customer funds by promising that Celsius would lend these assets to institutional borrowers, generating returns far exceeding anything traditional financial institutions could offer. The facade began cracking in mid-2022 as broader crypto markets entered a severe downturn and high-profile failures shook investor confidence. Celsius customers, growing increasingly nervous about their deposits, began requesting withdrawals in high volumes, creating a classic bank run scenario that exposed the platform’s fundamental insolvency. Celsius founder Alex Mashinsky was sentenced to 12 years in prison for defrauding investors with false promises of high crypto returns. #Celsius #AlexMashinsky https://t.co/R4syyDiKaU — Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) May 9, 2025 On June 12, 2022, Celsius froze all customer withdrawals and, within weeks, filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection, revealing a massive $1.19 billion hole in its balance sheet that left hundreds of thousands of depositors facing potential total losses. Federal prosecutors later revealed the extent of Mashinsky’s deception, showing how he had knowingly misled customers about Celsius’s financial health while directing employees to use new customer deposits to pay promised yields to existing users in a Ponzi-like scheme. Most egregiously, prosecutors proved that Mashinsky had been secretly selling his personal CEL token holdings while publicly claiming he wasn’t selling. Creditor Recovery Success Contrasts Sharply with FTX Debacle While FTX creditors face the frustrating reality of receiving payments based on November 2022 cryptocurrency valuations, when Bitcoin traded at just $17,583 compared to over $109,000 today, Celsius creditors have benefited from more favorable recovery terms that better reflect actual market conditions during the distribution process. Defunct crypto lender @CelsiusNetwork crypto lender has announced a second payout of $127 million to its creditors. #CryptoLender #Celsius https://t.co/fiZ0ctQybG — Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) November 28, 2024 Celsius has already distributed over $2.53 billion to approximately 251,000 creditors through multiple payout rounds, with the most recent November 2024 distribution adding another $127 million from the “Litigation Recovery Account.” These payments have covered nearly two-thirds of eligible creditors and represent 93% of total claim value, a remarkably high recovery rate for a major cryptocurrency platform failure. The success stems partly from the relatively quick resolution of the bankruptcy proceedings and the litigation administrator’s aggressive pursuit of asset recovery through various legal channels. The contrast with FTX becomes even more pronounced when considering the complexity and duration of each bankruptcy process. While FTX continues to grapple with what attorney Andrew Dietderich described as “27 quintillion” claims, including many fraudulent submissions, Celsius has managed to streamline its creditor verification and payout processes. FTX, the collapsed cryptocurrency exchange that shook the industry in late 2022, is set to begin repaying its creditors on May 30. #FTX #Crypto https://t.co/pNRaarc5nG — Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) March 30, 2025 FTX’s repayment plan, which began distributions in May 2025 targeting $16.5 billion in total recoveries , faces ongoing challenges from creditors who argue they’re being shortchanged due to the outdated valuation methodology that doesn’t account for dramatic cryptocurrency price appreciation since the platform’s collapse. As it stands now, Sam Bankman-Fried is serving a 25-year sentence and is projected for release in December 2044. Mashinsky, on the other hand, is now serving 12 years while being completely cut off from any financial recovery. headline: Shocking: Donald Trump Denies Iran Peace Talks Amid Rising Geopolitical Risk
summary: BitcoinWorld Shocking: Donald Trump Denies Iran Peace Talks Amid Rising Geopolitical Risk In a move that reverberated across political circles and global markets, former U.S. President Donald Trump took to his preferred platform, Truth Social , to vehemently deny reports suggesting the initiation of Iran peace talks . His blunt statement dismissed the claims as “HIGHLY FABRICATED, FAKE NEWS,” adding a layer of uncertainty to already complex international relations. For those navigating the volatile world of cryptocurrency, understanding such geopolitical shifts is crucial, as they can introduce significant Geopolitical risk that ultimately impacts the Crypto market impact . What Exactly Did Donald Trump Say on Truth Social? Using his distinctive style, Donald Trump directly addressed the rumors via a post on Truth Social . He was unequivocal, stating he had made no contact with Iran regarding negotiations. He further challenged Iran, suggesting they knew how to reach him if they genuinely desired talks. Referencing past opportunities, Trump added, “They should have taken the deal that was on the table – Would have saved a lot of lives!!!” This statement not only shut down the idea of current talks but also underscored his perspective on past diplomatic efforts with the nation. Trump’s choice of platform, Truth Social , is noteworthy in itself. Since being banned from major social media sites like Twitter (now X) and Facebook following the January 6th events, he has primarily used his own platform to communicate directly with his supporters and the public. This makes Truth Social a key channel for understanding his current views and potential future policy directions, which can have indirect implications for global stability and, by extension, financial markets, including crypto. Understanding the Context: Why are Iran Peace Talks Significant? The relationship between the United States and Iran has been fraught with tension for decades, marked by periods of confrontation, sanctions, and failed diplomatic attempts. The idea of Iran peace talks represents a potential de-escalation of hostilities, a pathway towards resolving significant disagreements over issues like nuclear programs, regional influence, and economic sanctions. Past efforts, such as the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA), commonly known as the Iran nuclear deal, aimed to curb Iran’s nuclear activities in exchange for sanctions relief. Donald Trump withdrew the U.S. from this deal in 2018, reimposing sanctions and significantly increasing tensions. Therefore, any mention of renewed Iran peace talks carries significant weight, signaling a potential shift in policy or a response to ongoing pressures. The denial by Donald Trump is significant because it comes at a time when regional dynamics remain volatile. It signals that, at least from his perspective or potential future stance, direct negotiations are not on the immediate horizon. This lack of dialogue or a clear diplomatic path contributes directly to Geopolitical risk . How Does Geopolitical Risk Connect to Crypto Market Impact? You might wonder, what does a denial of Iran peace talks by Donald Trump have to do with Bitcoin, Ethereum, or other cryptocurrencies? The connection lies in the fundamental principle that global events, particularly those involving major powers and potential conflict zones, introduce uncertainty into financial markets. This is known as Geopolitical risk . Here’s how Geopolitical risk can influence the Crypto market impact : Increased Uncertainty: Political instability or the threat of conflict makes investors nervous. They may become more risk-averse, pulling funds out of assets perceived as volatile or risky. Flight to Safety (or not): Traditionally, assets like gold or government bonds are considered safe havens during times of uncertainty. Bitcoin has sometimes been argued to serve a similar role, but its correlation with traditional risk assets (like tech stocks) means it often falls when traditional markets do. Macroeconomic Effects: Tensions in the Middle East, for instance, can impact oil prices, leading to inflation concerns. Central banks might react with monetary policy changes, which in turn affect liquidity and investment appetite for assets like crypto. Regulatory Scrutiny: Heightened global tensions can increase focus on how digital assets might be used for illicit finance or sanctions evasion, potentially leading to calls for stricter regulation on crypto. Investor Sentiment: Negative global headlines can simply dampen overall investor enthusiasm and confidence across all markets, including crypto. While the direct, immediate impact of Donald Trump’s statement on Truth Social denying Iran peace talks might seem distant from the daily fluctuations of the Crypto market impact , it contributes to the broader tapestry of global uncertainty that influences investor decisions. Savvy crypto participants understand that external macro factors, including Geopolitical risk , play a significant role in market movements, sometimes even more so than crypto-specific news. Navigating Uncertainty: Challenges and Actionable Insights The primary challenge posed by situations like the denial of Iran peace talks and the resulting Geopolitical risk is increased market volatility. Predicting the exact Crypto market impact of such events is difficult because crypto markets react to a confluence of factors. However, there are actionable insights for crypto holders and traders: Stay Informed: Pay attention not just to crypto news but also to major global political and economic developments. headline: KuCoin Pay and Cryptorefills Partner To Open Global Web3 Payments To 40 M+ Customers

KuCoin Pay users can now spend several cryptocurrencies on flights, hotels, gift cards, airtime and more on Cryptorefills. KuCoin Pay , the official payment solution of global cryptocurrency exchange KuCoin, is partnering with Cryptorefills , a leading Web3 global payment gateway. The partnership will enable over 40 million customers on KuCoin Exchange to access various travel and lifestyle services. Cryptorefills allows users to spend cryptocurrencies on real-world assets and services, including global travel bookings, everyday digital purchases, e-gifts and e-SIMs, etc. Starting today, KuCoin users will be able to benefit from these services directly via the KuCoin App or connect their wallets on the Cryptorefills website. Every service on Cryptorefills will be accessible to KuCoin users via both platforms, allowing them to spend 50+ cryptocurrencies, including Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), Tether (USDT), Circle USD (USDC), Solana (SOL) and KuCoin Token (KCS). Cryptorefills enables users in over 180 countries to spend crypto on their daily needs. The platform allows users to access cheap flights, stay in hotels around the world, use e-SIMs, and make mobile top-ups in select countries. Additionally, users can spend their crypto on gift cards in ecommerce, games, entertainment, streaming services, electronics, E-money and other products. The platform started out accepting BTC on the Lightning Network and Ethereum Layer 2 solutions, promoting scalable crypto commerce. “Travel is a natural fit for cryptocurrency. By building a robust crypto commerce ecosystem, including QR code checkout, native app integration, and merchant partnerships, KuCoin Pay positions itself as a trailblazer in Web3 payments and decentralized finance. headline: Why are Bitcoin and crypto prices going down today?
summary: Bitcoin and most cryptocurrencies retreated on Tuesday as geopolitical risks intensified ahead of the upcoming Federal Reserve interest rate decision. Bitcoin ( BTC ) dropped from this week’s high of $108,915 to an intraday low of $105,500. Ethereum ( ETH ) retreated by over 2.2%, while the total market capitalization of all cryptocurrencies declined to $3.28 trillion. Additional data shows that crypto liquidations surged by 25% in the past 24 hours to over $359 million. Some of the top laggards were coins like SPX6900 ( SPX ), Immutable ( IMX ), Fartcoin ( FARTCOIN ), Pepe ( PEPE ), and Worldcoin ( WLD ). The ongoing sell-off in the crypto industry mirrored that of the stock market, as the Dow Jones and Nasdaq 100 indices fell by 165 and 100 points, respectively. Bitcoin and crypto prices fell amid growing fears of a wider war in the Middle East rose. These concerns intensified after Donald Trump urged residents of Tehran to evacuate , signaling that he anticipates further bombing in the coming days. Impact of the Middle East crisis on Bitcoin and crypto prices The escalating crisis is impacting Bitcoin, altcoins, and other risk assets due to its effects on crude oil and inflation. Historically, crypto prices tend to perform better when the Fed is cutting rates or signaling future cuts. Still, history shows that Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies often rebound after major geopolitical or macroeconomic shocks. For instance, in March 2020, Bitcoin plunged from over $10,000 to below $4,000 after COVID was declared a pandemic, only to rally to a record high later that year. summary: BitcoinWorld Trump Iran Standoff: Geopolitical Uncertainty Hits Markets Global events, even those seemingly distant from the digital realm, often send ripples through financial markets, and the dynamic cryptocurrency space is no exception. A recent statement regarding Trump Iran relations highlights how geopolitical developments can introduce significant uncertainty, potentially influencing investor sentiment and market movements worldwide. Understanding the Trump Iran Negotiation Stance According to a report from JinSe Finance, U.S. President Donald Trump has indicated that he is currently unwilling to engage in negotiations with Iran. This statement underscores the continued complexity and tension surrounding US Iran relations . While the specific reasons for this stance ‘at present’ weren’t detailed in the brief report, it follows a period of heightened friction, sanctions, and disagreements over various issues, including Iran’s nuclear program and regional activities. The history between the two nations is fraught with challenges, making dialogue difficult. Key points of contention have included: The U.S. withdrawal from the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA), commonly known as the Iran nuclear deal. The re-imposition and escalation of U.S. sanctions targeting Iran’s economy, particularly its oil exports. Regional proxy conflicts and maritime security issues. Calls for Iran to curb its ballistic missile program and support for regional militias. Against this backdrop, any statement regarding the willingness or unwillingness to negotiate is closely watched by analysts and market participants alike, as it can signal the potential trajectory of future interactions – towards de-escalation or further confrontation. What are the Potential Implications of This Geopolitical Tension? A breakdown or refusal of negotiation pathways between major global players like the U.S. and Iran can have multifaceted implications. This specific instance of geopolitical tension stemming from President Trump’s statement suggests a continuation, if not an intensification, of the current standoff rather than a move towards diplomatic resolution. Potential implications include: Increased Regional Instability: Continued lack of dialogue could fuel proxy conflicts and military posturing in the Middle East. Economic Pressure: Sanctions remain a primary tool, and a refusal to negotiate suggests these pressures will not only continue but could potentially be tightened further, impacting Iran’s economy and global oil markets. Uncertainty for Allies and Adversaries: Nations with relationships with either the U.S. or Iran must navigate this delicate situation, potentially leading to shifts in alliances or policies. Impact on Global Diplomacy: The U.S. approach to Iran sets a precedent for its foreign policy and relations with other nations facing similar pressures. This state of diplomatic freeze contributes to a broader sense of global uncertainty, a factor that significantly influences financial markets. How Does Geopolitical Tension Impact the Market? When tensions rise between significant nations: Stock Markets: Often react negatively, with indices potentially seeing downturns as investors become risk-averse. Sectors tied to global trade or specific regions might be particularly affected. Oil Prices: Tensions in the Middle East, a major oil-producing region, frequently lead to volatility and potential spikes in oil prices due to fears of supply disruptions. Safe-Haven Assets: Demand for traditional safe-haven assets like gold and the U.S. dollar typically increases as investors seek refuge from perceived higher risk. Bond Markets: Government bonds of stable countries may see increased demand, leading to lower yields. The refusal to negotiate adds another layer of unpredictability, making it harder for analysts to forecast future economic conditions or market movements, thus contributing to potential volatility. Connecting the Dots: Geopolitical Tension and the Crypto Market The crypto market , while distinct from traditional finance, is not immune to global macroeconomic and geopolitical forces. While some early narratives positioned Bitcoin as a completely uncorrelated asset or a ‘digital gold’ safe haven, its increasing integration into the global financial system means it reacts to broader market sentiment and events. Here’s how geopolitical tension like the Trump-Iran situation can potentially affect the crypto market: Risk-Off Sentiment: If escalating tensions lead to a broader ‘risk-off’ environment in traditional markets, this sentiment can spill over into crypto, particularly impacting altcoins and even Bitcoin as investors reduce exposure to perceived riskier assets. Safe-Haven Narrative Test: Increased demand for traditional safe havens like gold might prompt discussions or observations on whether Bitcoin acts similarly. Historically, Bitcoin’s reaction has been mixed, sometimes correlating with tech stocks (risk-on) and sometimes showing signs of safe-haven demand during specific crises. Currency Devaluation Concerns: In countries directly affected by sanctions or instability, citizens might turn to cryptocurrencies as an alternative store of value or means of transaction if their national currency faces devaluation. Increased Volatility: Overall market uncertainty fueled by geopolitics often translates to increased volatility across assets, including cryptocurrencies, creating both potential risks and opportunities for traders. While a direct, immediate cause-and-effect between President Trump’s specific statement and a crypto price movement is hard to isolate, the statement contributes to the overall global risk assessment that influences investor behavior across all asset classes. Navigating Uncertainty: Challenges and Actionable Insights The primary challenge posed by this kind of geopolitical tension is the inherent unpredictability. The situation can change rapidly based on further statements, actions, or external events. For those involved in financial markets, including the crypto market, this creates a complex environment to navigate. Challenges: Difficulty in forecasting market reactions. Increased potential for sudden price swings. Emotional decision-making driven by fear or speculation. Actionable Insights: Stay Informed: Monitor both traditional geopolitical news and crypto-specific news sources. Understand the broader global context. Risk Management: Re-evaluate your portfolio’s risk exposure. Consider diversifying or adjusting positions based on your risk tolerance in times of heightened uncertainty. Avoid Panic: Geopolitical events can trigger emotional responses. Stick to your investment strategy rather than making impulsive decisions based on short-term news. Understand Correlations: Pay attention to how crypto assets are correlating with traditional assets like stocks, gold, or oil during periods of tension. While President Trump’s current unwillingness to negotiate with Iran is a specific diplomatic stance, its significance lies in what it signals about the ongoing state of US Iran relations and the potential for continued geopolitical tension to influence the global stage and, by extension, the financial markets, including the ever-evolving crypto market . Conclusion: Geopolitics Remains a Factor for Crypto Investors The news that President Trump is not willing to negotiate with Iran ‘at present’ serves as a reminder that the world’s political landscape is intrinsically linked to its economic one. This specific instance of Trump Iran friction adds another layer of uncertainty to the global environment. While the crypto market has its unique drivers, it operates within this larger context. Geopolitical events contributing to instability or shifts in global economic outlook can and do impact investor sentiment and capital flows, ultimately influencing the market impact felt across asset classes, including digital currencies. Staying aware of these broader global forces is crucial for anyone navigating the complexities of the crypto market . headline: ARK Invest Sells $52M in Circle Shares Just 11 Days After IPO—Profit-Taking or Red Flag?

ARK Invest Trims Circle Stake After 387% Post-IPO Rally The move marks ARK’s first reduction in its Circle position since acquiring shares during the June 5 IPO. On that day, ARK snapped up around 4.49 million shares, spending $373.4 million based on the closing price. Despite the recent sale, Circle remains one of the top holdings across ARK’s three major funds: the ARK Innovation ETF (ARKK), the ARK Next Generation Internet ETF (ARKW), and the ARK Fintech Innovation ETF (ARKF). ARKW and ARKF followed, selling 92,310 and 53,981 shares, respectively. Combined, the sale accounts for about 7.6% of ARK’s original Circle position. Circle’s stock has surged since going public. It opened at $31 on June 5 and closed at $151.06 on June 16. That represents a 387% gain in less than two weeks. The stock hit an intraday high of $165.60 before easing by the close. At yesterday’s price, ARK’s remaining 4.15 million shares are now worth approximately $628 million, well above its initial investment. The timing of ARK’s partial exit coincides with Circle reaching record highs, suggesting a possible strategy to lock in early profits amid strong market enthusiasm. Still, the asset manager maintains substantial exposure to Circle. ARKK holds the largest slice, valued at $387.7 million and making up 6.6% of its portfolio. ARKW and ARKF follow closely, each holding over 6.7% of their portfolios in CRCL. Neither ARK nor Wood has commented publicly on the sale. However, the rapid rise in Circle’s valuation raises questions about whether ARK is simply securing gains or taking a cautious approach after a steep rally. Circle’s listing and the sharp increase in its stock price have brought renewed attention to tokenization and digital asset firms entering public markets.
